clinical_study.brief_title: Ursodeoxycholic Acid Combined With Low Dose Glucocorticoid in the Treatment of PBC With AIH Features II
clinical_study.official_title: Ursodeoxycholic Acid Combined With Low Dose Glucocorticoid in the Treatment of PBC With AIH Features II：A Randomized Controlled Open-label Clinical Trial

brief_summary.textblock: A randomized controlled open-label clinical trial of ursodeoxycholic acid combined with low dose glucocorticoid in the treatment of PBC With AIH Features II to asses efficacy and safety.

primary_outcome.description: The percentage of patients in biochemical remission, defined as normalization of serum ALT and IgG levels after treatment, per treatment group.

secondary_outcome.description: Partial remission, defined as ALT or AST serum levels >1x Upper Limit of Normal (ULN) and <2x ULN
Minimal response, defined as decrease of ALT or AST serum levels but still >2x ULN
defined as no improvement or increase of ALT or AST serum levels
percentage of T cells, cDC, MDSC, Treg, Breg, plasma cells, NK, NKT

arm_group.description: Ursodeoxycholic Acid 13-15mg/kg/d+Methylprednisolone 12mg/d in induction period and 2-4mg/d in maintenance period

intervention.description: Participants received Methylprednisolone (12mg/d po. in induction and 2-4mg/d in maintenance) combined with Ursodeoxycholic acid (13-15mg/kg/d po.)

facility.name: Division of Gastroenterology & Hepatology,West China Hospital,Sichuan University
